map.title: Economic and International Trade Indicators
map.body:
This section provides a map displaying for each country the total population, some macro-economic indicators, main imported and exported goods ,and main trade partner countries.

Moreover, a time-lapse functionality to represent the international trade year-on-year monthly variations for the last three years is provided.

extra-ue.title: International Trade Relations UE - Extra UE
extra-ue.body:
This section shows the graph plot of international trade based on COMEXT transport data (NSTR classification), along with relevant global and local measures detailing the structure of relations between UE and Extra UE countries. The panel is interactive, providing the possibility to apply several filters and to see how the graph structure and measures change accordingly.

Furthermore an animation is provided showing the evolution of the international trade graph over time, spanning the entire time window of trading data.
extra-ue.link: Go to Graph analisys section UE - Extra UE

intra-ue.title: International Trade Relations UE - World
intra-ue.body:
This section shows the graph plot of international trade based on COMEXT data, with CPA 2.1 product classification, along with relevant global and local measures detailing the structure of relations between UE countries and their economic partners. The panel is interactive, providing the possibility to apply several filters and to see how the graph structure and measures change accordingly.

Furthermore an animation is provided showing the evolution of the international trade graph over time, spanning the entire time window of trading data.
intra-ue.link: Go to Graph analisys section UE - World

timeseries.title: Time Series
timeseries.body: Visualization tool for monthly COMEXT foreign trade data. Despite the large amount of underlying data, it allows an easily understandable series reading. Time series are provided in euros and dowload is available in various formats.

trade.title: Changes in basket composition of traded products (CPA - classification of products by activity) by Member State
trade.body: This section provides, for each Member State, the monthly time series of year-over-year changes in the basket composition of exported and imported goods, classified according to CPA-2 digits.
trade.link: Go to Basket of traded products section

main.title: Economic and International Trade Indicators
main.body: This section provides a map displaying for each country the total population, some macro-economic indicators, main imported and exported goods ,and main trade partner countries. Moreover, a time-lapse functionality to represent the international trade year-on-year monthly variations for the last three years is provided.

main.title: International Trade Relations
main.subtitle: Graph analysis
main.body:
The “International Trade Relations” Panel shows the graph analysis of the international trades between countries.
Data are relative to all trades between countries present in the COMEXT dataset. The requested data can be selected through filters. Countries are identified by their flags and their relative positions in the graph are given by the “Spring layout algorithm” implemented in the Network library.

metrics.subtitle: Metrics
metrics.body:
The following metrics derive from standard centrality measures of Graph Analysis.
  • Product spread: Graph density. Represents how much the product is spread through the graph.
    • Exportation strength: it is the outdegree centrality for each country.
  • Vulnerability: it is calculated as 1 - the indegree centrality for each country. The vulnerability conveys the message that a country receiving a product from several countries is less dependent on singles countries for the product supply.
  • Hubness: it is the closeness centrality of the countries.

filter.title: Search filters description
filter.body:
Period: select the required time period for data underlying the graph (specific month or year)
Percentage: select the percentage of data shown in the graph (integer value from 0 to 100). Once the percentage value is selected the data are filtered according to the following procedure: all the amounts (values in Euro) traded between countries (all edges) are listed in a descending order, then the cumulative sum is calculated along the list, from the top. All the trades associated to a cumulative sum above the percentage value, taken as threshold, are filtered out. This means that small trading amounts are considered in the graph only when “percentage” takes an high value.
Transport: select data according to the means of transport used in the trades. The listed means of transport are:
“unknown”, “sea”, “rail”, “road”, ”air”, “post”, “fixed mechanism”, “inland waterway”, “self-propulsion”.
Product: select data according to the product exchanged in the trades. The user can select either a single product or all of them together.
Flow: select either “Export” data or “Import” data, coming from two separate datasets.
Weight: select the type of graph analysis. “True” select the weighted type of graph, “False” select the unweighted type of graph. Values for the links weights are the amounts (values in Euro) exchanged in the trades.
